English: Hello there! I may have something useful for you. Would you mind taking a look in my bag?
Vietnamese: Hello there! I may have something useful for you. Would you mind taking a look in my bag?

English: I'm just walking around and selling stuff.
Vietnamese: I'm just walking around and selling stuff.

English: I don't know what items will be available when, so come back whenever you have time. Hehe
Vietnamese: I don't know what items will be available when, so come back whenever you have time. Hehe

English: Arrr, ye got that look in yer eye! Reminds me of when I was a young scallywag, barely old enough to tie me own boots. There I was, face to face with a storm that could sink the fiercest ship. But here I am, still breathin'! Takes a bit o' grit to survive out here, but I reckon ye've got what it takes.
Vietnamese: Arrr, ye got that look in yer eye! Reminds me of when I was a young scallywag, barely old enough to tie me own boots. There I was, face to face with a storm that could sink the fiercest ship. But here I am, still breathin'! Takes a bit o' grit to survive out here, but I reckon ye've got what it takes.

English: Ahoy! Captain Sovann, scourge o’ the seas of Madrigal! I’ve clashed blades and cannons in countless battles, and more than a few of 'em against the dark forces of Shade herself. Ain't many who could boast survivin’ such encounters! If there’s danger to face or treasure to seize, ye can bet ol' Sovann’s been there!
Vietnamese: Ahoy! Captain Sovann, scourge o’ the seas of Madrigal! I’ve clashed blades and cannons in countless battles, and more than a few of 'em against the dark forces of Shade herself. Ain't many who could boast survivin’ such encounters! If there’s danger to face or treasure to seize, ye can bet ol' Sovann’s been there!

English: As ye embark on yer journey through these treacherous waters and enchanted lands, remember Madrigal’s beauty is as deadly as it is mesmerizing. Stay sharp, bold traveler, for adventure may beckon, but danger lurks beneath every wave. Fare thee well, and may the tides favor ye till we cross paths again!
Vietnamese: As ye embark on yer journey through these treacherous waters and enchanted lands, remember Madrigal’s beauty is as deadly as it is mesmerizing. Stay sharp, bold traveler, for adventure may beckon, but danger lurks beneath every wave. Fare thee well, and may the tides favor ye till we cross paths again!

English: Ahoy! Fresh faces like yers bring new fire to these old sails. With a mate like ye, I just might find the spark for me next grand venture on the high seas!
Vietnamese: Ahoy! Fresh faces like yers bring new fire to these old sails. With a mate like ye, I just might find the spark for me next grand venture on the high seas!

English: Sailing the high seas is more than just a test of strengt it’s an art, a blend of courage, wit, and the call o’ the unknown. If yer heart yearns for the thrill of discovery and the clash of steel, know that I’ll be here, ready to welcome ye on ventures wild and grand!
Vietnamese: Sailing the high seas is more than just a test of strengt it’s an art, a blend of courage, wit, and the call o’ the unknown. If yer heart yearns for the thrill of discovery and the clash of steel, know that I’ll be here, ready to welcome ye on ventures wild and grand!

English: Uncover the secrets within the Revolutionary Journal, and great rewards await you
Vietnamese: Uncover the secrets within the Revolutionary Journal, and great rewards await you

English: I mean… what could really happen in a place this quiet? A short break won’t hurt, right?
Vietnamese: I mean… what could really happen in a place this quiet? A short break won’t hurt, right?

English: My name’s Doran. I’m an airport guard… though it’s honestly duller than I expected. You’re from across the sea, right? Seen anything interesting?
Vietnamese: My name’s Doran. I’m an airport guard… though it’s honestly duller than I expected. You’re from across the sea, right? Seen anything interesting?

English: I don’t recognize any of you. Who are you? You’re not one of those wolves, are you?
Vietnamese: I don’t recognize any of you. Who are you? You’re not one of those wolves, are you?

English: I'm Chiron, a soldier stationed here. We can forgive an old man for failing a mission, but not for neglecting his watch.
Vietnamese: I'm Chiron, a soldier stationed here. We can forgive an old man for failing a mission, but not for neglecting his watch.

English: Hey, look at those clouds. Doesn’t that one look like a cat’s face?
Vietnamese: Hey, look at those clouds. Doesn’t that one look like a cat’s face?

English: Hey there, I’m Bran! Sometimes listening is more important than guarding… don’t you think?
Vietnamese: Hey there, I’m Bran! Sometimes listening is more important than guarding… don’t you think?

English: This airport feels safe, doesn’t it? But have you ever seen fire fall from the sky where you thought you were safe?
Vietnamese: This airport feels safe, doesn’t it? But have you ever seen fire fall from the sky where you thought you were safe?

English: I'm Karr. If you drop your guard during wartime, that moment might be your last.
Vietnamese: I'm Karr. If you drop your guard during wartime, that moment might be your last.

English: …Do you need something?
Vietnamese: …Do you need something?

English: My name’s Zerke. Keep your questions short. I’ll help if I can.
Vietnamese: My name’s Zerke. Keep your questions short. I’ll help if I can.

English: It feels good to protect something, doesn’t it?
Vietnamese: It feels good to protect something, doesn’t it?

English: I'm Elin. My job is to make sure everyone coming through here stays safe.
Vietnamese: I'm Elin. My job is to make sure everyone coming through here stays safe.

English: Protecting a village isn’t simple. All those lives rest on us.
Vietnamese: Protecting a village isn’t simple. All those lives rest on us.

English: I am Gard. I’m one of the guardians who protect this place.
Vietnamese: I am Gard. I’m one of the guardians who protect this place.

English: Hello! Beautiful morning, isn’t it? I’m Gard.
Vietnamese: Hello! Beautiful morning, isn’t it? I’m Gard.

English: Even cats need a break sometimes. Still, patrol never stops.
Vietnamese: Even cats need a break sometimes. Still, patrol never stops.

English: I’m Liont. If my jokes get old, bear with me. I’ll keep this village safe.
Vietnamese: I’m Liont. If my jokes get old, bear with me. I’ll keep this village safe.

English: Why am I a guard? Because it’s cool. Simple as that.
Vietnamese: Why am I a guard? Because it’s cool. Simple as that.

English: War? I’m not afraid of it. I’ll fight until my last breath.
Vietnamese: War? I’m not afraid of it. I’ll fight until my last breath.

English: I’m Serkan. Need a reason to fight? I don’t. I just enjoy facing strong enemies.
Vietnamese: I’m Serkan. Need a reason to fight? I don’t. I just enjoy facing strong enemies.

English: Let’s make today a good one. Victory awaits.
Vietnamese: Let’s make today a good one. Victory awaits.

English: Why don’t those dogs come near us? Easy. They’re scared of our claws.
Vietnamese: Why don’t those dogs come near us? Easy. They’re scared of our claws.

English: Call me Kras. I protect this village.
Vietnamese: Call me Kras. I protect this village.

English: I used to be an adventurer like you… until I took an arrow to the knee.
Vietnamese: I used to be an adventurer like you… until I took an arrow to the knee.

English: A new face. I hope we stay on friendly terms.
Vietnamese: A new face. I hope we stay on friendly terms.

English: I’m Maeron. I’ve fought for a long time, and I’ll keep fighting until we win.
Vietnamese: I’m Maeron. I’ve fought for a long time, and I’ll keep fighting until we win.

English: You’re not ready.
Vietnamese: You’re not ready.

English: Great day for patrol. Is there even such a thing as bad weather? Not for me.
Vietnamese: Great day for patrol. Is there even such a thing as bad weather? Not for me.

English: My name’s Kerion. I’m on patrol—let me know if you spot anything odd.
Vietnamese: My name’s Kerion. I’m on patrol—let me know if you spot anything odd.

English: Go, adventurer… go.
Vietnamese: Go, adventurer… go.

English: It’s wonderful seeing everyone living in peace, isn’t it?
Vietnamese: It’s wonderful seeing everyone living in peace, isn’t it?

English: I’m Raon! No one loves this village more than me.
Vietnamese: I’m Raon! No one loves this village more than me.

English: You can’t pass.
Vietnamese: You can’t pass.

English: Stay calm. If the soldiers panic, who will the villagers rely on?
Vietnamese: Stay calm. If the soldiers panic, who will the villagers rely on?

English: I am Dreon, Captain Baron’s loyal left hand. Everything I do is for this village.
Vietnamese: I am Dreon, Captain Baron’s loyal left hand. Everything I do is for this village.

English: The guy next to me? He’s connected. Says he’s friends with someone named Waldo.\nDo you know who that is?
Vietnamese: The guy next to me? He’s connected. Says he’s friends with someone named Waldo.\nDo you know who that is?

English: You’ve made it this far… but from here on, things might get dangerous.
Vietnamese: You’ve made it this far… but from here on, things might get dangerous.

English: I’m Merk, head of scouting. Seen any Lycan activity?
Vietnamese: I’m Merk, head of scouting. Seen any Lycan activity?

English: Quiet. Scouting only works if we stay hidden.
Vietnamese: Quiet. Scouting only works if we stay hidden.

English: Protecting the village is an honor, but never easy—especially when those beasts outside keep baring their fangs.
Vietnamese: Protecting the village is an honor, but never easy—especially when those beasts outside keep baring their fangs.

English: I am Baron, captain of Eillun’s guards. As the shield and sword of this place, I won’t allow any threat near our people. Under my command, no one slacks off.
Vietnamese: I am Baron, captain of Eillun’s guards. As the shield and sword of this place, I won’t allow any threat near our people. Under my command, no one slacks off.

English: The Lycans are growing bolder. Keep your weapon ready.
Vietnamese: The Lycans are growing bolder. Keep your weapon ready.

English: This village has a long history… a very long one. But you don’t need to know everything. Sometimes knowledge becomes a burden.
Vietnamese: This village has a long history… a very long one. But you don’t need to know everything. Sometimes knowledge becomes a burden.

English: I am Gaurang, the Jarl. I’ve protected this village for decades. My bones ache with age, yet the afterlife still refuses to take me. Strange, isn’t it?
Vietnamese: I am Gaurang, the Jarl. I’ve protected this village for decades. My bones ache with age, yet the afterlife still refuses to take me. Strange, isn’t it?

English: Welcome to Eillun Village. I hope you enjoy your stay.
Vietnamese: Welcome to Eillun Village. I hope you enjoy your stay.

English: A new visitor… Let’s hope that’s a good sign.
Vietnamese: A new visitor… Let’s hope that’s a good sign.

English: I am Ayr, one of the elders. I’ve helped uphold this village for a long time. It’s been harder lately, though. Maybe you’ll bring change.
Vietnamese: I am Ayr, one of the elders. I’ve helped uphold this village for a long time. It’s been harder lately, though. Maybe you’ll bring change.

English: sigh The jarl threw his work at me again today…\nI’m too old for this. Can’t even retire quietly.
Vietnamese: sigh The jarl threw his work at me again today…\nI’m too old for this. Can’t even retire quietly.

English: Do you always trust what you see? Think it through.
Vietnamese: Do you always trust what you see? Think it through.

English: I’m Elder Traitus, in charge of supplies. Now then… how am I supposed to find enough for today?
Vietnamese: I’m Elder Traitus, in charge of supplies. Now then… how am I supposed to find enough for today?

English: We’re not like the Khajiit… not like them at all.
Vietnamese: We’re not like the Khajiit… not like them at all.

English: Sometimes protecting the village requires sacrifice. It’s harsh, but true.
Vietnamese: Sometimes protecting the village requires sacrifice. It’s harsh, but true.

English: I’m Melak, responsible for security with Baron. Things get worse every day. Please don’t give me another reason to worry. I’ll be keeping an eye on you.
Vietnamese: I’m Melak, responsible for security with Baron. Things get worse every day. Please don’t give me another reason to worry. I’ll be keeping an eye on you.

English: It’s dangerous to go alone.
Vietnamese: It’s dangerous to go alone.

English: How long are we going to sit around? We need to strike back and show them who we are.
Vietnamese: How long are we going to sit around? We need to strike back and show them who we are.

English: I am Silar. There’s one way to protect this village: make our enemies fear us more than we fear them.
Vietnamese: I am Silar. There’s one way to protect this village: make our enemies fear us more than we fear them.

English: We have a great communicator here… want to guess who?
Vietnamese: We have a great communicator here… want to guess who?

English: Is a long life a blessing? Stay too long in a place you were meant to leave, and the ground starts to feel like it’s sinking under you.
Vietnamese: Is a long life a blessing? Stay too long in a place you were meant to leave, and the ground starts to feel like it’s sinking under you.

English: I’m Ebron, just an old man with too much spare time. Live long enough and you start noticing things others don’t.
Vietnamese: I’m Ebron, just an old man with too much spare time. Live long enough and you start noticing things others don’t.

English: Time is a strange thing, isn’t it?
Vietnamese: Time is a strange thing, isn’t it?

English: Stock up on supplies before you leave. Better to have too much than too little.
Vietnamese: Stock up on supplies before you leave. Better to have too much than too little.

English: I’m Liana, owner of the general store. Traveler or villager, I’ll make sure you get what you need.
Vietnamese: I’m Liana, owner of the general store. Traveler or villager, I’ll make sure you get what you need.

English: Hand over the Penya peacefully, and no one gets hurt.
Vietnamese: Hand over the Penya peacefully, and no one gets hurt.

English: Look at this gemstone! It’s not just jewelry—it’s art.
Vietnamese: Look at this gemstone! It’s not just jewelry—it’s art.

English: I’m Teron. When it comes to gems, my eyes are sharper than anyone’s. I can find the perfect one for you.
Vietnamese: I’m Teron. When it comes to gems, my eyes are sharper than anyone’s. I can find the perfect one for you.

English: Jewels are art! Do you appreciate art? Train your eye—your skills might improve along with it.
Vietnamese: Jewels are art! Do you appreciate art? Train your eye—your skills might improve along with it.

English: Good armor is like having a second life.
Vietnamese: Good armor is like having a second life.

English: I’m Haret. Picking armor isn’t about preference—it’s survival. Think you’ll find better quality anywhere else? Doubt it.
Vietnamese: I’m Haret. Picking armor isn’t about preference—it’s survival. Think you’ll find better quality anywhere else? Doubt it.

English: You won’t find armor like this anywhere else. Buy today and I’ll even give you a small discount.
Vietnamese: You won’t find armor like this anywhere else. Buy today and I’ll even give you a small discount.

English: A good weapon never betrays its wielder. Find one that suits you.
Vietnamese: A good weapon never betrays its wielder. Find one that suits you.

English: Name’s Domir. Swords, axes, bows—whatever you need, I can forge it.
Vietnamese: Name’s Domir. Swords, axes, bows—whatever you need, I can forge it.

English: You sure you’re happy with that weapon? You deserve better. Let me show you something nice.
Vietnamese: You sure you’re happy with that weapon? You deserve better. Let me show you something nice.

English: Attacking is important, but if you can’t defend yourself, you won’t last a battle.
Vietnamese: Attacking is important, but if you can’t defend yourself, you won’t last a battle.

English: I’m Toran, the best shieldsmith in the village. If you need a shield crafted, I’m your guy.
Vietnamese: I’m Toran, the best shieldsmith in the village. If you need a shield crafted, I’m your guy.

English: That shield won’t last long out here. Lucky for you, I’ve got a sturdier one.
Vietnamese: That shield won’t last long out here. Lucky for you, I’ve got a sturdier one.

English: Fresh off the fire! I’ve even got a warm pot of soup. Want a bowl?
Vietnamese: Fresh off the fire! I’ve even got a warm pot of soup. Want a bowl?

English: I’m Karen, the best cook in the village. And no, my secret recipes aren’t going anywhere.
Vietnamese: I’m Karen, the best cook in the village. And no, my secret recipes aren’t going anywhere.

English: Fresh goods from the forest! Stock up before you travel.
Vietnamese: Fresh goods from the forest! Stock up before you travel.

English: A staff or wand is just a tool. The real magic depends on the person holding it.
Vietnamese: A staff or wand is just a tool. The real magic depends on the person holding it.

English: I’m Nebrah, seller of magical tools. If you know how to handle these properly, they’ll bring great power.
Vietnamese: I’m Nebrah, seller of magical tools. If you know how to handle these properly, they’ll bring great power.

English: Interested in magic? I’ve got wands, staves, robes—take a look.
Vietnamese: Interested in magic? I’ve got wands, staves, robes—take a look.

English: Color carries emotion. The flowers around here create shades no dye can match.
Vietnamese: Color carries emotion. The flowers around here create shades no dye can match.

English: I’m Sena. I dye fabrics with flowers and plants. Your clothes would look beautiful with my colors.
Vietnamese: I’m Sena. I dye fabrics with flowers and plants. Your clothes would look beautiful with my colors.

English: Take a look.
Vietnamese: Take a look.

English: Wounds heal with time… but the right treatment helps a lot.
Vietnamese: Wounds heal with time… but the right treatment helps a lot.

English: I’m Rohan. I tend to the injured. It used to be peaceful work, but lately it’s been exhausting.
Vietnamese: I’m Rohan. I tend to the injured. It used to be peaceful work, but lately it’s been exhausting.

English: Time is money, friend.
Vietnamese: Time is money, friend.

English: Knowledge is the strongest weapon. Those beasts fight with teeth, but we defeat them with wit.
Vietnamese: Knowledge is the strongest weapon. Those beasts fight with teeth, but we defeat them with wit.

English: I’m Belia. I teach young Myurans our history and wisdom. Learning never ends.
Vietnamese: I’m Belia. I teach young Myurans our history and wisdom. Learning never ends.

English: If you want to share knowledge with us, you’d better learn our unit system. The YP Law is pretty great, honestly.
Vietnamese: If you want to share knowledge with us, you’d better learn our unit system. The YP Law is pretty great, honestly.

English: The stars reveal many things. Tonight’s constellations hint at change.
Vietnamese: The stars reveal many things. Tonight’s constellations hint at change.

English: I’m Kerin. I read the stars for glimpses of the future. Your fate… well, I’m not supposed to say.
Vietnamese: I’m Kerin. I read the stars for glimpses of the future. Your fate… well, I’m not supposed to say.

English: But I do believe you’re strong enough to face whatever comes.
Vietnamese: But I do believe you’re strong enough to face whatever comes.

English: Hunting isn’t just catching prey—it’s understanding nature.
Vietnamese: Hunting isn’t just catching prey—it’s understanding nature.

English: I’m Artin, the village hunter. I bring in fresh meat. Those dogs make it harder lately, but it’s still my job.
Vietnamese: I’m Artin, the village hunter. I bring in fresh meat. Those dogs make it harder lately, but it’s still my job.

English: Wanna communicate with mother Nature? Follow me!
Vietnamese: Wanna communicate with mother Nature? Follow me!

English: Trees are alive. I just help shape their lives into new forms.
Vietnamese: Trees are alive. I just help shape their lives into new forms.

English: I’m Pael. I carve fallen branches from the great town tree. Their memories live through my work.
Vietnamese: I’m Pael. I carve fallen branches from the great town tree. Their memories live through my work.

English: To speak to living trees, you must use your true name and put your heart into it. I am Pael. I am Pael.
Vietnamese: To speak to living trees, you must use your true name and put your heart into it. I am Pael. I am Pael.

English: Dreams send messages from within. Understanding them can reveal the truth.
Vietnamese: Dreams send messages from within. Understanding them can reveal the truth.

English: I’m Lumi. I listen to people’s dreams and help them find meaning. Had any strange ones lately?
Vietnamese: I’m Lumi. I listen to people’s dreams and help them find meaning. Had any strange ones lately?

English: Let me show you… a world of dreams and imagination.
Vietnamese: Let me show you… a world of dreams and imagination.

English: The stars hold the stories of our ancestors. Their wisdom still guides us.
Vietnamese: The stars hold the stories of our ancestors. Their wisdom still guides us.

English: I’m Ivelyn. I study the constellations. If I learn enough, I might even predict when those dogs will attack.
Vietnamese: I’m Ivelyn. I study the constellations. If I learn enough, I might even predict when those dogs will attack.

English: May the ancestors watch over you.
Vietnamese: May the ancestors watch over you.

English: A scent can hold a memory. One drop of my perfume might bring back something long forgotten.
Vietnamese: A scent can hold a memory. One drop of my perfume might bring back something long forgotten.

English: I’m Selin, a maker of perfumes. I wonder which scent suits you best.
Vietnamese: I’m Selin, a maker of perfumes. I wonder which scent suits you best.

English: The same fragrance smells different on everyone. That’s the magic of it.
Vietnamese: The same fragrance smells different on everyone. That’s the magic of it.

English: Hey! Don’t tell the adults you saw me here. Seriously—don’t.
Vietnamese: Hey! Don’t tell the adults you saw me here. Seriously—don’t.

English: I'm Kaela. Go home? Not happening. Wolves or not, I can handle myself.
Vietnamese: I'm Kaela. Go home? Not happening. Wolves or not, I can handle myself.

English: Grown-ups love saying “no.” It’s the one word I can’t stand.
Vietnamese: Grown-ups love saying “no.” It’s the one word I can’t stand.

English: Every event carries a lesson. A good story makes it easier to hear.
Vietnamese: Every event carries a lesson. A good story makes it easier to hear.

English: I’m Livia. I collect and share our people’s stories. Want to share yours?
Vietnamese: I’m Livia. I collect and share our people’s stories. Want to share yours?

English: Old legends always hide clues—ways to survive today.
Vietnamese: Old legends always hide clues—ways to survive today.

English: One day… I’ll earn their respect, no matter what it takes.
Vietnamese: One day… I’ll earn their respect, no matter what it takes.

English: I’m Taila. It’s a secret, but I’m actually the jarl’s—…no, I shouldn’t say more.
Vietnamese: I’m Taila. It’s a secret, but I’m actually the jarl’s—…no, I shouldn’t say more.

English: If I say it out loud, I feel like everything might fall apart. So it stays a secret.
Vietnamese: If I say it out loud, I feel like everything might fall apart. So it stays a secret.

English: What are you doing here? Most people don’t even know this place exists.
Vietnamese: What are you doing here? Most people don’t even know this place exists.

English: You’re not ready to know the truth. But if you grow stronger… maybe that’ll change.
Vietnamese: You’re not ready to know the truth. But if you grow stronger… maybe that’ll change.

English: Turn back. You’re not qualified.
Vietnamese: Turn back. You’re not qualified.

English: Where did we go so wrong!? It’s good they aren’t attacking, but still…
Vietnamese: Where did we go so wrong!? It’s good they aren’t attacking, but still…

English: I'm Beck, from Saint City. I joined the New World Expedition and ended up stuck here. Missed the ship home, sadly.
Vietnamese: I'm Beck, from Saint City. I joined the New World Expedition and ended up stuck here. Missed the ship home, sadly.

English: People—! A person is here! Help!
Vietnamese: People—! A person is here! Help!

English: Keeping watch here isn’t easy. You never know what might creep out of the darkness.
Vietnamese: Keeping watch here isn’t easy. You never know what might creep out of the darkness.

English: Me? I’m the guardian of Ankou’s Asylum. Someone has to make sure the nightmares stay inside.
Vietnamese: Me? I’m the guardian of Ankou’s Asylum. Someone has to make sure the nightmares stay inside.

English: Feeling brave today? Just remember—I warned you.
Vietnamese: Feeling brave today? Just remember—I warned you.

English: If you make it through Ankou’s madness, come find me. I’d love to hear your story… assuming you’re still sane.
Vietnamese: If you make it through Ankou’s madness, come find me. I’d love to hear your story… assuming you’re still sane.

English: Earn 2 random Statue Effects (buffs or debuffs).
Vietnamese: Earn 2 random Statue Effects (buffs or debuffs).

English: Earn 1 Statue Buff (buff only).
Vietnamese: Earn 1 Statue Buff (buff only).

English: Change your current statue buff at random.
Vietnamese: Change your current statue buff at random.

English: Just… leave me alone. I need to rest my eyes.
Vietnamese: Just… leave me alone. I need to rest my eyes.

English: I thought I could face him alone… but he was much stronger than I expected. Please be ready if you plan to fight him.
Vietnamese: I thought I could face him alone… but he was much stronger than I expected. Please be ready if you plan to fight him.

English: Alone… I didn't stand a chance.
Vietnamese: Alone… I didn't stand a chance.

English: Very well. What do you need?
Vietnamese: Very well. What do you need?

English: Stay vigilant. In wartime, a moment's carelessness can be fatal.
Vietnamese: Stay vigilant. In wartime, a moment's carelessness can be fatal.

English: Come see me if you're hurt. Proper treatment makes all the difference.
Vietnamese: Come see me if you're hurt. Proper treatment makes all the difference.

English: Safety is my responsibility here. I take that duty seriously.
Vietnamese: Safety is my responsibility here. I take that duty seriously.

English: This place is quiet, but that doesn't mean we can let our guard down completely.
Vietnamese: This place is quiet, but that doesn't mean we can let our guard down completely.

English: A soldier's watch must never fail. We protect this place with our lives.
Vietnamese: A soldier's watch must never fail. We protect this place with our lives.

English: I hope your visit brings good fortune to our village.
Vietnamese: I hope your visit brings good fortune to our village.

English: Pay attention to what you hear. Sometimes the most important information comes when you're listening, not watching.
Vietnamese: Pay attention to what you hear. Sometimes the most important information comes when you're listening, not watching.

English: The ship left without me, but I can't dwell on that. Life goes on, and so must I.
Vietnamese: The ship left without me, but I can't dwell on that. Life goes on, and so must I.

English: Quick question—can you handle a task for me?
Vietnamese: Quick question—can you handle a task for me?

English: I need someone reliable. Think you're up for it?
Vietnamese: I need someone reliable. Think you're up for it?

English: I've got injured people piling up. Could you help me gather some supplies?
Vietnamese: I've got injured people piling up. Could you help me gather some supplies?

English: There's something dangerous out there. I need someone to investigate.
Vietnamese: There's something dangerous out there. I need someone to investigate.

English: Bored of guard duty yet? I've got something more interesting if you're interested.
Vietnamese: Bored of guard duty yet? I've got something more interesting if you're interested.

English: We've spotted suspicious activity. I need someone to check it out.
Vietnamese: We've spotted suspicious activity. I need someone to check it out.

English: A visitor like you might be able to help with something the locals can't.
Vietnamese: A visitor like you might be able to help with something the locals can't.

English: I overheard something important. Want to help me follow up on it?
Vietnamese: I overheard something important. Want to help me follow up on it?

English: I'm stuck here, but maybe you could help me with something back home?
Vietnamese: I'm stuck here, but maybe you could help me with something back home?

English: Our supplies are running low. Could you help me gather what we need?
Vietnamese: Our supplies are running low. Could you help me gather what we need?

English: That shield you're carrying looks weak. I've got a job that might earn you a better one.
Vietnamese: That shield you're carrying looks weak. I've got a job that might earn you a better one.

English: I've found some interesting gems, but I need help appraising them properly.
Vietnamese: I've found some interesting gems, but I need help appraising them properly.

English: There's something I need to tell you… but first, can you help me with a small task?
Vietnamese: There's something I need to tell you… but first, can you help me with a small task?

English: Those Lycans are getting bolder. I need someone to help me track their movements.
Vietnamese: Those Lycans are getting bolder. I need someone to help me track their movements.

English: I'm looking for a real fight. Think you can point me toward something challenging?
Vietnamese: I'm looking for a real fight. Think you can point me toward something challenging?

English: I've been working on some new colors. Want to help me test them out?
Vietnamese: I've been working on some new colors. Want to help me test them out?

English: I've been hearing strange things in people's dreams lately. Can you help me investigate?
Vietnamese: I've been hearing strange things in people's dreams lately. Can you help me investigate?

English: More wounded keep coming in. I could really use some help gathering medical supplies.
Vietnamese: More wounded keep coming in. I could really use some help gathering medical supplies.

English: I love this village, but there's something I need help protecting.
Vietnamese: I love this village, but there's something I need help protecting.

English: The trees have been whispering. They want me to find something. Will you help?
Vietnamese: The trees have been whispering. They want me to find something. Will you help?

English: I've got some powerful magic tools, but I need help testing them safely.
Vietnamese: I've got some powerful magic tools, but I need help testing them safely.

English: You shouldn't be here. But since you are… maybe you can help me with something.
Vietnamese: You shouldn't be here. But since you are… maybe you can help me with something.

English: I've spotted some unusual Lycan movements. Want to help me scout the area?
Vietnamese: I've spotted some unusual Lycan movements. Want to help me scout the area?

English: I've been fighting for so long. Maybe you can help me finish this once and for all.
Vietnamese: I've been fighting for so long. Maybe you can help me finish this once and for all.

English: I've been having strange dreams about you. Want to help me understand what they mean?
Vietnamese: I've been having strange dreams about you. Want to help me understand what they mean?

English: I collect stories, and I think yours might be worth hearing. But first, help me with something?
Vietnamese: I collect stories, and I think yours might be worth hearing. But first, help me with something?

English: Those dogs won't come near us, but something else might. Want to help me keep watch?
Vietnamese: Those dogs won't come near us, but something else might. Want to help me keep watch?

English: I'm on patrol, but I spotted something that needs investigating. Care to join me?
Vietnamese: I'm on patrol, but I spotted something that needs investigating. Care to join me?

English: The stars are telling me something important. I need your help to understand it.
Vietnamese: The stars are telling me something important. I need your help to understand it.

English: I've got fresh food ready, but I need help delivering it to some people. Interested?
Vietnamese: I've got fresh food ready, but I need help delivering it to some people. Interested?

English: Hey, don't tell anyone you saw me, but I could use your help with something.
Vietnamese: Hey, don't tell anyone you saw me, but I could use your help with something.

English: This village has secrets. I might share one if you help me with a task.
Vietnamese: This village has secrets. I might share one if you help me with a task.

English: I've been watching the constellations. Something's coming, and I need help preparing.
Vietnamese: I've been watching the constellations. Something's coming, and I need help preparing.

English: I've got injured soldiers who need better armor. Can you help me gather materials?
Vietnamese: I've got injured soldiers who need better armor. Can you help me gather materials?

English: I thought I could handle it alone, but I was wrong. Can you help me finish what I started?
Vietnamese: I thought I could handle it alone, but I was wrong. Can you help me finish what I started?

English: The stars have shown me something about you. Help me, and I'll tell you what I saw.
Vietnamese: The stars have shown me something about you. Help me, and I'll tell you what I saw.

English: Good armor saves lives. I need help getting materials to make more. Can you assist?
Vietnamese: Good armor saves lives. I need help getting materials to make more. Can you assist?

English: I'm loyal to Captain Baron, but there's something I need to handle personally. Will you help?
Vietnamese: I'm loyal to Captain Baron, but there's something I need to handle personally. Will you help?

English: I've lived too long in one place. Help me with this, and maybe I can finally move on.
Vietnamese: I've lived too long in one place. Help me with this, and maybe I can finally move on.

English: I've been teaching the young ones, but there's something I need to learn myself. Can you help?
Vietnamese: I've been teaching the young ones, but there's something I need to learn myself. Can you help?

English: I forge weapons, but I need rare materials. Think you can help me find them?
Vietnamese: I forge weapons, but I need rare materials. Think you can help me find them?

English: The village needs protection, and I need someone I can trust. Are you that person?
Vietnamese: The village needs protection, and I need someone I can trust. Are you that person?

English: I'm an elder, and I've seen many things. Help me with this, and I'll share what I know.
Vietnamese: I'm an elder, and I've seen many things. Help me with this, and I'll share what I know.

English: The nightmares are getting stronger. I need someone brave enough to help me contain them.
Vietnamese: The nightmares are getting stronger. I need someone brave enough to help me contain them.

English: Hunting's been tough lately. I could use help tracking down some prey.
Vietnamese: Hunting's been tough lately. I could use help tracking down some prey.

English: Security is getting worse every day. I need someone to help me investigate a threat.
Vietnamese: Security is getting worse every day. I need someone to help me investigate a threat.

English: Welcome to the #b#cffff0000Eillun Quest Office#nc#nb! Looking for work? I may have a job for you...
Vietnamese: Welcome to the #b#cffff0000Eillun Quest Office#nc#nb! Looking for work? I may have a job for you...

English: Welcome to the Quest Office! The local citizens have issued the following quests. Please select the quest you wish to take from the list below.
Vietnamese: Chào mừng đến với Quest Office! Các công dân địa phương đã đưa ra các nhiệm vụ sau đây. Vui lòng chọn nhiệm vụ bạn muốn nhận từ danh sách bên dưới.

English: My apologies, there are no quests available for an adventurer of your talent and skill at this time.
Vietnamese: Tôi xin lỗi, không có nhiệm vụ nào dành cho một nhà thám hiểm tài năng và kỹ năng như bạn vào lúc này.

English: My name is Miorang and I am the manager of the Eillun Quest Office. When our citizens post a hunting order or another task, it is my job to find the right candidate for the job. Check back in from time to time to see if I have anything available!
Vietnamese: My name is Miorang and I am the manager of the Eillun Quest Office. When our citizens post a hunting order or another task, it is my job to find the right candidate for the job. Check back in from time to time to see if I have anything available!

English: Farewell!
Vietnamese: Tạm biệt!

English: Welcome to the #b#cffff0000Office.#nc#nb of Eillun. How can I be of service?
Vietnamese: Welcome to the #b#cffff0000Office.#nc#nb of Eillun. How can I be of service?

English: So what can you do for me, huh?
Vietnamese: Bạn có thể làm những gì cho tôi, huh?

English: Ugh... maybe next time.
Vietnamese: Ugh... maybe next time.

English: My name is Cheirang and I manage the Office of Eillun. How can I help you today?
Vietnamese: My name is Cheirang and I manage the Office of Eillun. How can I help you today?

English: Farewell!
Vietnamese: Tạm biệt!

English: Welcome to Eillun! Please, enjoy your stay!
Vietnamese: Welcome to Eillun! Please, enjoy your stay!

English: Hello, traveler. I have some missions for you!
Vietnamese: Xin chào, lữ khách Tôi có một số nhiệm vụ cho bạn!

English: Eillun is the heart of Madrigal’s blooming spirit. Our trees may tower over the skies, but our hospitality always reaches further. Should you ever seek guidance, come find me beneath the Great Blossom.
Vietnamese: Eillun is the heart of Madrigal’s blooming spirit. Our trees may tower over the skies, but our hospitality always reaches further. Should you ever seek guidance, come find me beneath the Great Blossom.

English: I am the mayor of Eillun. The harmony of our blossoms and our people is what I cherish most. How may I assist you today beneath our great trees?
Vietnamese: I am the mayor of Eillun. The harmony of our blossoms and our people is what I cherish most. How may I assist you today beneath our great trees?

English: Farewell!
Vietnamese: Tạm biệt!

English: I've spotted a security issue that needs immediate attention. Can you handle it?
Vietnamese: I've spotted a security issue that needs immediate attention. Can you handle it?
